revised_title: The Structure and Function of Eu-Latero-Frontal Cirri in Mytilus edulis
tldr: The study investigates the structure and function of eu-latero-frontal cirri in the mussel, Mytilus edulis. The cirri consist of 22-26 pairs of cilia arranged in two parallel rows and have a unique bending and branching pattern that forms a mesh between cirri and gill filaments. This structure allows for efficient filtering and retention of particles in the mussel's gill.
